parts: i need an easy video editing tool. I just need to crop out one section of a homemade video, no advanced modifications needed

If you just need to crop out a section of a video (i.e. trim or cut part of it), here are a few **easy and free tools**—no advanced editing skills required:

---

### ✅ **Easiest Web-Based Editors (No Install)**
These run in your browser. Great for small, quick edits:

#### 1. **[Clideo – Video Cutter](https://clideo.com/cut-video)**
- Drag and drop video, select the segment to keep, and export.
- Pros: Super intuitive, supports most formats.
- Cons: Free version has watermark.

#### 2. **[Kapwing](https://www.kapwing.com/video-editor)**
- Trim, crop, and export quickly.
- Free plan supports basic edits.
- No watermark if you sign up for a free account.

#### 3. **[VEED.IO](https://www.veed.io/)**
- Drag the ends of the timeline to trim the section you want.
- Easy to use, free version with watermark.

---

### ✅ **Offline Editors (No Internet Needed)**

#### 4. **VLC Media Player (Free)**
- Yes, VLC can do basic trimming!
- Open your video → View → Advanced Controls → Play to the start of the segment, click Record → Stop at end.
- Saves a trimmed version.

#### 5. **Shotcut (Free and Open Source)**
- Lightweight, simple timeline editor.
- Just import the video → use split/cut tools → export.
- No watermarks, no limitations.

---

### ✅ **If You're on a Phone:**

#### iOS: **iMovie (Free from Apple)**
- Tap Edit → drag handles to crop → Save as new clip.

#### Android: **Google Photos App**
- Open video → Edit → Trim with slider → Save copy.

---

### 🔁 Summary Table

| Tool        | Platform     | Watermark? | Notes                            |
|-------------|--------------|------------|----------------------------------|
| Clideo       | Web          | Yes        | Fast, easy, watermark unless paid |
| Kapwing      | Web          | No*        | Free account avoids watermark     |
| VEED         | Web          | Yes        | Very intuitive, some features gated |
| VLC          | Desktop      | No         | Slightly clunky, but works offline |
| Shotcut      | Desktop      | No         | Open-source, no limitations       |
| iMovie       | iOS          | No         | Native, fast, intuitive           |
| Google Photos| Android      | No         | Already installed on many phones |

---

Let me know your platform (Windows/Mac/Linux/Phone), and I can walk you through the steps directly.
